bookCover.coverDescription: Let's learn interactively how to point using this, that, these and those.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: This is used to point an object, animal, or person near to us.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: That is used to point an object, animal or person far from us.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: This and That are used to point to one object, animal, person etc.
1) Look at the pictures given below and select the correct option which describes the picture.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

choices.question: -
answers:
This is a bus.

That is a bus.

params.text: The table given below shows the difference between This, That, These, and Those.
If the object, person, or object we are pointing to is singular and near we use this whereas if the object, person, or object we are pointing to is plural and near we use these.
If the object, person, or object we are pointing to is singular and far we use that whereas if the object, person, or object we are pointing to is plural and far we use those.

questions:
a) *This* (These/This) is a chair.

b) *That*(That/Those) is my uncle.

c) *These*(This/These) are oranges.

d) *This*(This/These) is a bat.

e) *Those*(That/Those) are my guests.

f) *This*(These/This) is my school.

g) *That*(That/Those) is a parrot.

h) *These*(These/This) are tomatoes.

i) *This*(This/ These) is my bicycle.
